TEXT: The applicants are CARDINAL individuals , whose names , nationalities , residences and DATE of birth are listed in the attached annex . They are represented before the ORG by Mr PERSON , a lawyer practicing in GPE . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent , PERSON and later on by PERSON .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
On DATE at a New Year ’s party in ORG , GPE , a certain ORG , a member of ORG , shot QUANTITY people to death and wounded CARDINAL others upon which he committed suicide .

On DATE each of the applicants instituted civil proceedings before ORG ( PERSON ) against the ORG seeking pecuniary and non - pecuniary damages sustained on account of the bodily injury of death of a close relative . They based their claim on LAW ( ORG o obveznim odnosima ) . The proceedings were subsequently joined .

On DATE ORG issued an interim judgment ( međupresuda ) whereby it found that the State held liability for the damages sustained by the applicants in CARDINAL , the other CARDINAL being ORG ’s personal liability .
Both parties appealed against the judgment .

On DATE the LAW to LAW ( “ the DATE LAW ) entered into force . The amended legislation provided that all proceedings instituted against the ORG for damage caused by members of ORG and police in the performance of their official duties during the Homeland War in GPE be stayed .
On DATE ORG stayed the proceedings pursuant to the above legislation .
On DATE the applicants filed a constitutional complaint concerning the length of the proceedings .

On DATE new legislation on the liability of the ORG for damage caused by members of ORG and police in the performance of their official duties during the Homeland War ( “ the DATE LAW ” ) entered into force .

On DATE ORG resumed the proceedings and the case - file was forwarded to ORG ( Županijski sud u GPE ) , being the appellate court . On DATE this court quashed the interim judgment of DATE and remitted the case to ORG .
ORG held a hearing on DATE .

On DATE ORG ( Ustavni sud PERSON ) found that the applicants’ right to a determination of their civil claim within a reasonable time and their right of access to a court had been violated and awarded each applicant CARDINAL NORP PERSON ( HRK ) as just satisfaction . Furthermore , it ordered ORG to adopt its decision in the shortest time possible but DATE from the publication of ORG decision in ORG .
On DATE ORG pronounced judgment rejecting the applicants’ claim .
On DATE the applicants appealed against the first instance judgment . The proceedings are currently pending before ORG .

Section CARDINAL ( a ) of the LAW to LAW ( Zakon o dopunama PERSON o obveznim odnosima , ORG no . CARDINAL of DATE ) provided that all proceedings instituted against the ORG for damage caused by members of ORG and police in the performance of their official duties during the Homeland War in GPE from CARDINAL DATE to DATE were to be stayed . The DATE Amendments also imposed an obligation on the Government to submit special legislation to ORG regulating liability for such damage within DATE of the Act entering into force .

The LAW on the liability of GPE for damage caused by members of the NORP army and police when acting in their official capacity during the Homeland war ( Zakon o odgovornosti PERSON štetu uzrokovanu od pripadnika hrvatskih oružanih i redarstvenih snaga tijekom Domovinskog rata , ORG no . CARDINAL of DATE ) regulates the conditions under which the ORG is liable to pay compensation for damage caused by members of the army and the police during the Homeland War . It also provides that all proceedings stayed pursuant to the DATE Amendments are to be resumed .
The relevant part of CARDINAL of LAW on LAW ( Ustavni zakon o PERSON , ORG no . CARDINAL of CARDINAL DATE – “ LAW ” ) reads as follows :

“ ( CARDINAL ) The Constitutional Court shall examine a constitutional complaint whether or not all legal remedies have been exhausted if the court with jurisdiction fails to decide a claim concerning the applicant ’s rights and obligations or a criminal charge against him or her within a reasonable time ...

( CARDINAL ) If a constitutional complaint ... under paragraph CARDINAL of this section is upheld , the Constitutional Court shall set a time - limit within which the court with jurisdiction must decide the case on the merits ...

( CARDINAL ) In a decision issued under paragraph CARDINAL of this section , the Constitutional Court shall assess appropriate compensation for the applicant for the violation of his or her constitutional rights ... The compensation shall be paid out of the ORG budget within DATE from the date a request for payment is lodged . ”
LAW , ORG no . CARDINAL of DATE ) reads as follows :

“ In the determination of his rights and obligations or of any criminal charge against him , everyone is entitled to a fair hearing within a reasonable time by an independent and impartial court established by law . ”
